intro: Cubeba clusii, commonly known as cubeb, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia and Africa. It is a member of the Piperaceae family, which includes other spice plants like black pepper. The plant is characterized by its erect, branching stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its small, greenish-white flowers are followed by the distinctive, aromatic, and slightly toxic berries. Cubeb is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
